entry.title: Jordan drops Oscar entry on Karabakh after pressure from Baku

media:group.media:title: Jordan drops Oscar entry on Karabakh after pressure from Baku
media:group.media:description:
üìç The COP29 United Nations climate change conference opened in Baku; Armenia is still undecided whether it is going to attend. üìç Jordan has withdrawn My Sweet Land, a documentary about Nagorno-Karabakh directed by ethnic Armenian filmmaker Sareen Hairabedian, as its official entry for the 97th Academy Awards' Best International Feature Film category following diplomatic pressure from Azerbaijan. üìç Swiss lawmakers rejected an Azerbaijani demand to withdraw a draft resolution on organizing an international peace conference on Nagorno-Karabakh. üìç 2024 US Election Results: After Trump Victory, We Look at What‚Äôs Next for Europe: civilnet.am/en/news/804947/2024-us-election-results-after-trump-victory-we-look-at-whats-next-for-europe

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan, Macron meet in Budapest
media:group.media:description:
üìç Sergey Shoigu, the chairman of Russia‚Äôs Security Council, claimed that Western countries interfere with the affairs in the South Caucasus, undermining security in the region. üìç Iran's Ambassador to Armenia, Mehdi Sobhani, said yesterday that a new bridge with higher capacity should be constructed at the border between the countries to boost trade. üìç Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and French President Emmanuel Macron met on the sidelines of the Fifth European Political Community Summit in Budapest.

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs place in Trump‚Äôs America
media:group.media:description:
In this post-election episode of the Civilnet podcast, political analyst Eric Hacopian breaks down the victory of Donald Trump in the U.S. presidential election and its far-reaching implications for Armenia. Hacopian examines how Trump's return to power could reshape America's approach to the South Caucasus region and potentially alter the balance of power among regional actors like Russia and Turkey.

entry.title: Baku can force peace on Yerevan, senior Azerbaijani official says

media:group.media:title: Baku can force peace on Yerevan, senior Azerbaijani official says
media:group.media:description:
üìç Azerbaijan‚Äôs chairman of the Security Council, Ramil Usubov, said Baku can force peace on Yerevan. üìç Armenian citizen Armen Balyan was arrested at Moscow's Domodedovo Airport on suspicion of fighting in the Ukrainian military against Russian forces. üìç Russia‚Äôs Foreign Intelligence Service claimed that the United States is planning to carry out a propaganda campaign aimed at discrediting Armenia's cooperation with Russia while also increasing its influence in the country using civil society groups. üìç Despite an existing contract signed last year to hold a concert by American hip hop star Snoop Dogg in Yerevan, the event has still not taken place, and the $6 million in public funds allocated for it have not been returned. üìç Single motherhood by choice a growing trend in Armenia: www.civilnet.am/en/news/804558/single-motherhood-by-choice-is-a-growing-trend-in-armenia/

entry.title: ‚ÄúLove in action‚Äù defines Jack Youredjian's philanthropy

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄúLove in action‚Äù defines Jack Youredjian's philanthropy
media:group.media:description:
Jack Youredjian has been implementing numerous charitable projects in Armenia for many years. The Child & Family Center of the Children of Armenia Fund near Myasnikyan village is being built with his support. Next to it, the foundation's second SMART Center in the Armavir region will be established. Youredjian provides scholarships to hundreds of Armenian students and is involved in numerous humanitarian initiatives in Gyumri.
He says that you shouldn't have to tell someone that you love them. You need to show love through action. He calls it "love in action."
Hagop Youredjian is also one of CivilNet's leading donors. Thanks to his support, we are able to provide broader coverage of Armenia.
CivilNet's Lara Cholakian spoke with Youredjian at the Lori SMART Center about his journey and projects.
